GapFillInput.Title: Participles and gerunds
GapFillInput.Instruction: Put the verb in brackets into the correct form. Type the answers in the gaps.

Content.Question:
1. Learning (learn) a new language is a difficult and time-consuming process.
2. Having said (say) that he was going to come at 5.00, he didn't show up till 9.00!
3. Any game played (play) non-stop for three hours becomes rather boring.
4. Having received (receive) the bike on Monday, Milly crashed on Tuesday.
5. After spraying (spray) the paint on, you need to leave it for a few hours to let it dry.
6. Having eaten (eat) six cows already, the giant lay down and slept.
7. The deal, finalised (finalise) in Rome, was to be the most important move the company had made.
8. The girl playing (play) the cello is supposed to be some kind of musical genius.
9. It would be appreciated if you could tidy the area before leaving (leave).
10. She celebrated wildly, having been awarded (award) the prize for the second year running.
